data: PED GYN AMB Heavy Menstrual Bleeding
Instruct patient to follow-up with GP if no referral to Gynaecology made
Give patient Menstrual Calendar on discharge
Discontinue previous hormonal management. For heavy menstrual bleeding, use contraceptive with at least 30 mcg ethinyl estradiol
300 mg, PO, BID, order duration: 90 day, drug form: tab, dispense qty: 180 tab, refill(s): 0
25 mg/kg, PO, as directed, PRN Up to 4 times per day, other (see comment), order duration: 5 day, drug form: tab, dispense qty: 20 tab, refill(s): 0, start: T;N
4 mg, PO, q8h, PRN Maximum of 3 doses/24 hours, nausea, drug form: tab, dispense qty: 10 tab, refill(s): 0, start: T;N
10 mg, PO, QID, PRN, nausea, drug form: tab, dispense qty: 10 tab, refill(s): 0, start: T;N
5 mg, PO, q6h, PRN, nausea, drug form: tab, dispense qty: 10 tab
10 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab, dispense qty: 90 tab, refill(s): 4
1 cap, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab, dispense qty: 3 packs, 4 Refill(s)
1 tab, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab, dispense qty: 3 packs, 4 Refill(s)
1 tab, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab, dispense qty: 3 packs, 4 Refill(s)
1 tab, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab, dispense qty: 4 packs, 4 Refill(s)
2 tab, PO, BID, Two times per day for 2 weeks, then 1 tablet daily continuously, drug form: tab, dispense qty: 3 packs, 0 Refill(s), start: T;N
1 tab, PO, qdaily, dispense qty: 4 packs, 4 Refill(s)
1 tab, PO, qdaily, dispense qty: 4 packs, 4 Refill(s)

Consider pelvic ultrasound for patients with second presentation of heavy menstrual bleeding: abdominal pain requiring analgesia: nausea requiring anti-emetics    Outpatient Pelvic US for patients with moderate acute heavy menstrual bleeding (Hb 100 to 120 g/L)
